Data.event_text: 9 January  Norilsk avalanche three dead, one in serious condition, and six missing in an avalanche in Norilsk which buried houses. An event like this has never happened in Norilsk, despite avalanches being common in the region, this was the first event of such magnitude in terms of fatalities and missing persons.

links.text: -"A teenager fights for life after being pulled from under 3m avalanche which killed his family". siberiantimes.com. Retrieved 2021-01-12.-

Data.event_text: 11 January  In Moscow, four soldiers are killed after a truck crashes into the convoy of buses they are in. 40 other soldiers were reported to be injured.

links.text: -"4 Russian soldiers die, over 40 injured in road crash". ABC News. Retrieved 2021-01-12.-

Data.event_text: 12 January  2021 Yekaterinburg fire [ru] eight people die in an apartment fire in Yekaterinburg. It is reported that the victims succumbed to carbon monoxide poisoning, rather than the flames. It is reported that among the eight fatalities, there was a child The cause of the fire is under investigation, and it is thought that the fire was accidental.

links.text: -"Eight Dead In Apartment Fire In Russian City Of Yekaterinburg". Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty. 12 January 2021. Retrieved 2021-01-12.-
-"Женщина, писавшая в Twitter о пожаре в Екатеринбурге, не могла дозвониться в МЧС". www.znak.com. Archived from the original on 2021-01-12. Retrieved 2021-01-12.-
-"Женщина, писавшая в Twitter о пожаре в Екатеринбурге, не могла дозвониться в МЧС". www.znak.com. Archived from the original on 2021-01-12. Retrieved 2021-01-12.-

Data.event_text: 23 January  Protests against the arrest of Alexei Navalny begin throughout Russia.

links.text: -Zverev, Anton (23 January 2021). "Police round up more than 350 at Russia protests backing jailed Kremlin foe Navalny". Reuters. Retrieved 23 January 2021.-

Data.event_text: 22 February  In ice hockey, New York Rangers winger and Kremlin critic Artemi Panarin takes a personal leave of absence after the Russian tabloid Komsomolskaya Pravda publishes a story in which former Kontinental Hockey League coach Andrei Nazarov accuses him of sexually assaulting a 18-year old Latvian woman in Riga.

links.text: -"Kremlin-Critical NHL Star Takes Leave over Assault Allegations". 23 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: 8 April  Secretary of Security Council of Russia Nikolai Patrushev denies reports of Russia's plans to intervene in Ukraine following reports of Russian troops amassing near the Russo-Ukrainian border.

links.text: -"Russia Says 'No Plans' to Intervene in Ukraine as Troops Mass". Bloomberg.com. Bloomberg. 7 April 2021. Retrieved 13 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: 11 May  Nine people are killed and 23 are injured following a mass shooting at a school in Kazan, the capital of Tatarstan .
29 May  Moscow Vostochny railway station is opened in Moscow and is the first new railway station to be built in the Russian capital since 1902.

links.text: -"В Москве открылся Восточный вокзал". Российская газета (in Russian). 29 May 2021. Retrieved 2021-08-26.-

Data.event_text: 3—6 June  XXIV St. Petersburg International Economic Forum takes place.
11 June — 11 July  UEFA Euro 2020. Gazprom Arena hosts some of the games.

links.text: -Евро-2020 может пройти в 13 городах по всей Европе Archived 2020-09-22 at the Wayback Machine.-
-Евро-2020 может пройти в 13 городах по всей Европе Archived 2020-09-22 at the Wayback Machine.-

Data.event_text: 6 July  An Antonov An-26 carrying 28 passengers and crews slams into a steep cliff while on approach to Palana. All 28 people on board are killed in the crash, including Olga Mokhireva, the mayor of Palana.

links.text: -"No survivors from plane crash in Russia's far east, rescue officials say". Reuters. 6 July 2021. Retrieved 6 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 6—8 July  At least eight people are killed by floods caused by heavy rains in Krasnodar Krai.

links.text: -"Floods Kill 8 in Southern Russia Resorts". The Moscow Times. 2021-07-08. Retrieved 2021-08-26.-

Data.event_text: 16 July  An Antonov An-28 operating as SiLA Airlines Flight 42 crash lands into a swamp in Tomsk Oblast following an engine failure mid-flight. Two injuries are reported in the incident.
2 August  A tornado kills three people in Andreapol (Tver Oblast).

links.text: -Movileanu, Arian; Dresch, Matthew (2021-08-04). "Deadly tornado spins across town at 60mph destroying 1,500 homes and killing 3". mirror. Retrieved 2021-08-26.-

Data.event_text: 12 September  A Let-410 operating as Siberian Light Aviation Flight 51 crashes in Irkutsk Oblast. 4 people are killed.
20 September  Six people are killed and 47 others injured in a mass shooting at Perm State University in Perm, Russia.
26 September  The 2021 Russian Grand Prix was held in the Sochi Autodrom. Lewis Hamilton achieved first place, ahead of Max Verstappen and Carlos Sainz.
10 October  2021 Menzelinsk parachute Let L-410UVP-E crash. 16 of the 22 people on board were killed.
15 October14 November  2021 Russian Census
25 November  51 people killed in the Listvyazhnaya mine disaster.

links.text: -"Death toll soars to 52 in Russian coal mine accident - reports". BBC News. 2021-11-25. Retrieved 2021-11-26.-

Data.event_text: 7 December  Gunman opens fire in Moscow services center, kills 2 people and injures 4.

links.text: -AFP, Ola Cichowlas for (2021-12-07). "Gunman Kills 2 in Shooting at Moscow Government Building". The Moscow Times. Retrieved 2021-12-12.-

Data.event_text: 13 December - Russia's domestic intelligence service said it had arrested 106 supporters of what it called a Ukrainian neo-Nazi youth group planning attacks and mass murders. The Federal Security Service (FSB) said the "Maniacs Cult of Murder" group had been set up by a Ukrainian under the patronage of Ukraine's intelligence services. The FSB, in its statement, said it had made detentions in 37 of Russia's more than 80 regions and that two of the detainees had planned to attack educational institutions.

links.text: -Zinets, Natalia (Dec 13, 2021). "Ukraine accuses Russia of information warfare after 'neo-Nazi' arrests". Reuters – via www.reuters.com.-
